materials.raw_text: Co: 10 g, Fe: 30 g, P: 5 g, Pr: 2 g, Binder (e.g., epoxy resin): 50 g, Filler (e.g., silica): 20 g, Hardener for epoxy: 10 g.

sourcing.instructions: Co: Specialty chemical suppliers, Fe: Metal supply stores or online retailers, P: Chemical supply companies, Pr: Rare earth material suppliers, Binder: Local hardware stores, Filler: Construction supply stores, Hardener: Local hardware stores.
steps: Co: Specialty chemical suppliers, Fe: Metal supply stores or online retailers, P: Chemical supply companies, Pr: Rare earth material suppliers, Binder: Local hardware stores, Filler: Construction supply stores, Hardener: Local hardware stores.

1. Weigh out 10 g of cobalt, 30 g of iron, 5 g of phosphorus, and 2 g of praseodymium precisely. 2. In a mixing bowl, combine the Co, Fe, P, and Pr. 3. Gradually add 50 g of epoxy resin while continuously stirring to create a uniform mixture. 4. Add 20 g of silica filler to enhance the material properties. 5. Mix thoroughly until all components are evenly distributed. 6. Finally, incorporate 10 g of hardener into the mixture. Stir for an additional 3-5 minutes.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 10 g of cobalt, 30 g of iron, 5 g of phosphorus, and 2 g of praseodymium precisely. 2. In a mixing bowl, combine the Co, Fe, P, and Pr. 3. Gradually add 50 g of epoxy resin while continuously stirring to create a uniform mixture. 4. Add 20 g of silica filler to enhance the material properties. 5. Mix thoroughly until all components are evenly distributed. 6. Finally, incorporate 10 g of hardener into the mixture. Stir for an additional 3-5 minutes.

steps: Preheat an oven to 200째C (392째F). Transfer the mixed material into a suitable mold that fits the dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. Heat in the oven for 1 hour to cure the epoxy and bond the materials.
heating.raw_text: Preheat an oven to 200째C (392째F). Transfer the mixed material into a suitable mold that fits the dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. Heat in the oven for 1 hour to cure the epoxy and bond the materials.

steps: After heating, turn off the oven and allow the mold to cool naturally inside the oven for 1 hour to prevent thermal shock. Once cooled, remove the mold and let the solid sample cool at room temperature for an additional 2 hours.
cooling.raw_text: After heating, turn off the oven and allow the mold to cool naturally inside the oven for 1 hour to prevent thermal shock. Once cooled, remove the mold and let the solid sample cool at room temperature for an additional 2 hours.

steps: If desired, sand the edges of the solid sample with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. Apply a sealant if additional protection is needed, following the manufacturer's instructions for application and curing time.
post_processing.raw_text: If desired, sand the edges of the solid sample with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. Apply a sealant if additional protection is needed, following the manufacturer's instructions for application and curing time.
